data.title: Civilization.ca
data.text:
Index | Part 1 | Part 2

Part 1  Mail-order Services, by Company

Army and Navy | Dupuis Frères | Eaton's | Henry Morgan & Company | Hudson's Bay Company |Paquet | P. T. Legaré | Simpson's and Simpsons-Sears | Woodward's

Army and Navy

Little research has been done on the history of Army and Navy. This company is not related to the firm of the same name that was founded in England in the second half of the 19th century. Located at the Vancouver store, the corporate archives contain catalogues, newspaper clippings, photographs, financial documents, etc.

Dupuis Frères

Primary Sources

Archives

Archives HEC Montréal

Fonds de Dupuis Frères Limitée 1868-1978, P049. This fonds contains textual records and other documents: annual reports, merchandise catalogues, Le Duprex, and photographs. It is the best source of information on the company, which declared bankruptcy.

Syndicat national des employés du commerce de Montréal (CTCC), "Pourquoi ils sont en grève?: Un document sur les relations patronales-ouvrières à la Maison Dupuis Frères Ltée." Montréal: Syndicat national des employés de commerce de Montréal, [1952?], 31 pp.

Library and Archives Canada, Ottawa

Fonds Michelle Tisseyre 1915-1997. This fonds contains textual records, including programs and texts written by Michelle Tisseyre for Dupuis Frères fashion shows held from 1951 to 1960.

Dupuis Frères Limitée. "Mémoire de la maison Dupuis Frères, Limitée / Dupuis Frères Limitée." Montréal: [np], 1956, 30 pp.

Comité de reclassement des ex-employés de Dupuis Frères. "Rapport final / Comité de reclassement des ex-employés de Dupuis Frères Ltée." [Montréal: s.n., 1979.]

Dupuis Frères Limitée. "Rapport annuel." Montréal: Dupuis Frères Limitée, 1868?-1978?

Syndicat national des employés du commerce de Montréal (CTCC). "Convention collective de travail intervenue entre le Syndicat national des employés du commerce de Montréal, CTCC et Dupuis frères Limitée, 28 juillet 1952." Montréal: Le Syndicat national des employés de commerce de Montréal, [1952?], 28 pp.

Committee on Price Spreads. Proceedings, Royal Commission on Price Spreads and Mass Buying, vol. 3, 1934.

Daily newspapers such as Le Devoir, The Montreal Star, and La Presse are a good source of information on the strike. Le Travail, the CTCC newsletter, is also very useful. Other documentation can be found at the Archives de la CSN in Montréal, as well as in the Dupuis Frères fonds held at Hautes Études Commerciales in Montréal, including the "scrapbook."

Secondary Sources

Publications

Benoit, M. "Des travailleurs mis à la retraite forcée." Vie ouvrière, 28, no. 123 (March 1978): 161-164.

Desbiens, Jean-Paul. "Les propos du mardi." Les Cahiers de Cap-Rouge, 6, no. 1 (1978): 74-88.

Desjardins, Noella. "Dupuis et Frères: Un centenaire canadien-français." Le Magazine de La Presse, Montréal, February 24, 1968.

Dugal, A.-J. "Voyage en zigzag à travers la publicité et le commerce deux amis inséparables: Conférence donnée par M. A.-J. Dugal, vice-président et directeur-gérant de Dupuis Frères Limitée, mercredi le 21 février 1940, à l'Auditorium du Plateau à Montréal." [Québec: np, 1940]. Montréal: Cie de publication La Patrie, 38 pp.

Dupuis-Leman, Josette. Dupuis Frères: Le magasin du peuple. Montréal: Stanké, 2001, 290 pp.

Fraser, G. "Don't Bother to Watch for the Grand Re-opening." Maclean's, February 20, 1978, p. 62.

Lefebvre, Jean-Marie. "Nazaire Dupuis." Dictionary of Canadian Biography,

vol. 10, pp. 289-290.

Lessard, Michel. "L'ère des grands magasins au Québec." Cap-aux-Diamants, no. 40 (Winter 1995).

Matthews, Mary Catherine. "Working for Family, Nation and God: Paternalism and the Dupuis Frères Department Store, Montréal, 1926-1952." Master's Thesis, Montréal: McGill University, 1998, 118 pp.

Quig, James. "A Department Store Bankruptcy that Was a Cultural Setback for Quebec." Canadian Business Magazine, 51 (April 1978): 28.

Raymond, Sylvie. "Entre mode et modestie: Sexe et pudeur chez Dupuis Frères." Cap-aux-Diamants, no. 40 (Winter 1995): 45-47.

Raymond, Sylvie. "Iconographie publicitaire de l'activité sportive: Le cas de Dupuis Frères dans La Presse, 1909-1952." Master's Thesis, Québec: Université Laval, 1995, 149 pp.

Sauriol, Marguerite. "La grève de 1952." Cap-aux-Diamants, no.72 (Winter 2003): 95.

Trudel, Robert. "Famille, Foi et Patrie: Le credo de Dupuis Frères." Cap-aux-Diamants, no. 40 (Winter 1995): 26-29.

Vadboncoeur, Pierre. "Dupuis Frères, 1952." En Grève: L'histoire de la CSN et des luttes menées par ses militants de 1937 à 1963. Montréal: Les éditions du Jour, 1963, pp. 99-128.

Willis, John. "Selling God by Post in French Canada." Revelations: Bi-Millenial Papers from the Canadian Museum of Civilization. Hull: Canadian Museum of Civilization, 2001, pp. 259-285.

Audiovisual Document

National Library of Canada, Ottawa, Dupuis Frères Limitée [video recording], "Le magasin du people," written and directed by Robert Verge. Montréal: Groupe Sagittaire, 2000, 47 min., 3 sec.

Web Sites

Dictionary of Canadian Biography Online. "Nazaire Dupuis." www.biographi.ca/EN/ShowBio.asp?BioId=39087

Library and Archives Canada. "Canadian Mail Order Catalogues." This site contains unabridged versions of some of the company's catalogues. www.bac-lac.gc.ca/eng/discover/postal-heritage-philately/canadian-mail-order-catalogues/Pages/canadian-mail-order-catalogues.aspx

Eaton's

Primary Sources

Archives

Archives of Ontario, Toronto, T. Eaton Company Collection, F229 (1792-1988). This fonds includes a large number of Eaton's catalogues (1881-1976), distribution reports, photographs, microfilms, videos, sound recordings, and architectural drawings. The Archives web site has a full description of this fonds and a listing of the catalogues it contains. Facsimiles of the 1901 and 1927 Eaton's catalogues are available in libraries. Fonds, F-229, Series 53, Box 1. Mail-order Procedures, "Mail-order Systems: Toronto, 1920-1926," and "Toronto and Moncton Systems Compared, 1933."

The Culture Division of the City of Toronto has 1600 objects donated by Eaton's.

The Saskatchewan Western Development Museum in Saskatoon has about 350 sales catalogues, many of which were donated by the company, including house, radio, grocery, and plumbing supply catalogues.

Secondary Sources

Publications

Barnes, Carolyn. Timothy Eaton. Ottawa: Canadian Library Association, ca 1981, 8 pp.

Bassett, John M. Timothy Eaton. Longueuil: Les Éditions Julienne, ca 1976, 59 pp.

Batts, Miaso. "Eaton's and Its Catalogues: An Expression of Canadian Social History." Costume 7 (1973): 68-69.

Brehl, John. "Centennial Story - Eaton's: Canada's Family Store." Winnipeg Tribune, February 22, 1969, p. 51.

Couturier, Jean Paul and Phyllis E. Leblanc, eds. Économie et société en Acadie 1850-1950. Moncton: Éditions d'acadie, 1996, 206 pp.

Dennis, Thelma. "Eaton's Catalogue Furnishings for Rural Alberta, 1886-1930." Alberta History, 37, no. 2 (Spring 1989): 21-31.

De Sève, Andrée-Anne. "Hourra! Le catalogue Eaton est arrivé." Cap-aux-diamants, no. 40 (Winter 1995): 18-22.

"La disparition du catalogue Eaton: Les travailleurs paient pour la crise capitaliste." L'Acayen (Bathurst, N.B.), 3, no. 2 (1976): 9-11.

Ditchett, S. H. Eaton's of Canada: A Unique Institution of Extraordinary Magnitude. In New York Dry Goods Economist. New York: Federal Printing Co., 1923, 60 pp.

Eaton, Flora. Memory's Wall: The Autobiography of Flora McCrea Eaton. Toronto: Clarke, Irwin, 1956, 214 pp.

Francis, Jean. A Treasury of Eaton's Beauty Dolls. Scarborough (Ontario): J. Francis, 1998, 48 pp.

Golden Jubilee, 1869-1919: A Book to Commemorate the Fiftieth Anniversary of the T. Eaton Co., Ltd. Toronto: T. Eaton Co., ca 1919, 288 pp.

Idoux, Raymond, "Marchandises en vedette: Eaton et l'imagerie commerciale." Cap-aux-Diamants, no. 40 (Winter 1995): 48-51.

In Memoriam: Mr. Timothy Eaton. [Toronto: np, 1907], 39 pp.

Lambert, Anne. "Images For Sale: How Eaton's Saw Us." Branching Out 4 (March-April 1977): 30-33.

MacPherson, M. E. Shopkeepers to a Nation: The Eatons. Toronto: McClelland and Stewart, 1963, 122 pp.

MacTaggart, Ken. "An Outsider Looks at the Inside of Eaton's: The Store for Young Canadians." Globe and Mail, September 20, 1944.

McQueen, Rod. The Eatons: The Rise and Fall of Canada's Royal Family. North York (Ontario): Stoddart, 1998, 320 pp.

Nasmith, George G. Timothy Eaton. Toronto: McClelland and Stewart, 1923, 312 pp.

O'Donnell, Lorraine. "A Small World: Representations of Women in the Eaton's Catalogue Covers, 1886-1975." Paper delivered at the Annual Meeting of the Canadian Historical Association, May 2001 (preliminary version of a chapter of her PhD thesis entitled "Visualising the History of Women at Eaton's, 1869 to 1976").

O'Donnell, Lorraine. "Visualising the History of Women at Eaton's, 1869 to 1976." Ph.D. Thesis, Montréal: McGill University, 2002, 488 pp.

Santink, Joy L. "Timothy Eaton." In The Canadian Encyclopedia, vol. 1. Edmonton: Hurtig Publishers Ltd., 1987, pp. 641-642.

Santink, Joy L. Timothy Eaton and the Rise of His Department Store. Toronto: University of Toronto Press, 1990, 319 pp.

Santink, Joy L. "Timothy Eaton." In Dictionary of Canadian Biography, vol. 13 (1901-1910). Toronto: University of Toronto Press, 1994, pp. 313-18.

Smith, Janice. "Content Analysis of Children's Clothing in Eaton's Catalogues and Selected Canadian Museums, 1890-1920." MA Thesis, Edmonton: University of Alberta, 1991.

A Souvenir of Eaton's Golden Jubilee, 1869-1919. Toronto: T. Eaton Co., 1919, 24 pp.

Staib, Kay. Eaton 100, 1869-1969: A Special Centennial Edition of Eaton Quarterly. Toronto: Eaton's, 1969, 31 pp.

Stephenson, William. The Store that Timothy Built. Toronto: McClelland and Stewart, ca 1969, 255 pp.

The Story of a Store: A History of the T. Eaton Co. Limited from 1869 to the Present Day. [Toronto: np, 1931?], 43 pp.

The Story of a Store: A History of the T. Eaton Co. Limited from 1869 to the Present Day. [Toronto: np, 1939?], 51 pp.

Sufrin, Eileen Tallman. The Eatons: The Campaign to Organize Canada's Largest Department Store, 1948 to 1952. Toronto: Fitzhenry and Whiteside, 1982, 240 pp.

T. Eaton Co. Votre avenir dans le commerce de détail. Montréal: T. Eaton Co Limited of Montreal, 1961?, 20 pp.

Toronto Daily Star. Series of articles about Eaton's centennial, 1869-1969. January 2-4, 6, 7, 1969.

Young, Mildred J. "Bachelor Ordered a Wife from Eaton's Catalogue." Early American Life, (April 1978): 21.

Research Reports

Baldwin, Betsey. "Athletic Wear and Fashion in Canada, 1900-1950." Library/Archives, Canadian Museum of Civilization, 1999-2000.

Baldwin, Betsey."The Millinery Trade in Decline, 1900-1930: The Displacement of Hat-making as a Professional Art at Eaton's." Library/Archives, Canadian Museum of Civilization, 1999-2000.

Baldwin, Betsey."Canadian Nationalism and the Eaton's Catalogue, 1900-1950." Library/Archives, Canadian Museum of Civilization, 1999-2000.

Belisle, Donica, "Consuming Producers, Retail Workers and Commodity Culture at Eaton's in Mid-Twentieth-Century Toronto." MA thesis, Kingston: Queen's University (History), 2001, 185 pp.

Cole, Catherine C. "Comparative Analysis of the Toronto and Winnipeg Editions of the Eaton's Mail-order Catalogue." Library/Archives, Canadian Museum of Civilization, 1995.

Cole, Catherine C. "Childhood in Prince George, 1910-1960." Fraser-Fort George Museum Society, Prince George, British Columbia, March 2002.

Cole, Catherine C. "The Wishing Book: Dreaming of Christmas in Central Alberta through the Eaton's Catalogues, 1925-1929, 1955-1959." Unpublished research report that includes oral histories, produced under the direction of Judy Larmour for the Red Deer and District Museum, October 2000.

Forbes, Susan L., "The Influence of the Social Reform Movement and T. Eaton Company's Business Practises on the Leisure of Eaton's Female Employees during the Early 20th Century." PhD thesis, London: University of Western Ontario (Kinesiology), 1991, 237 pp.

Hannis, Prudence. "Survey of the Eaton's Catalogue, 1881-1976: Household Appliances." Library/Archives, Canadian Museum of Civilization, 1996.

O'Connor, Eileen. "T. Eaton Co. Mail-order Catalogue, First Report: Assessment of Archival Material." Library/Archives, Canadian Museum of Civilization, 1995.

O'Connor, Eileen. "The Eaton's Mail-order Catalogue, 1884-1976: An Archival Analysis." Library/Archives, Canadian Museum of Civilization, 1996.

Thompson, Eleanor. "Eaton's Mail-order Catalogue: Oral History Project." Library/Archives, Canadian Museum of Civilization, 1995.

Thompson, Eleanor. "Eaton's Project: Eaton's Brand Names." Library/Archives, Canadian Museum of Civilization, nd.

Auviovisual Documents

Eaton's employee interviews conducted when the catalogue was discontinued, January 1, 1976, 11 minutes, 4 seconds. Call number P 006(1); Program: Eaton à Moncton (Fin du catalogue), Moncton, N.B., Magnetic Sound, Centre d'études acadiennes, University of Moncton.

Life Story of Canada's Greatest Merchant: The Late Mr. T. Eaton: A Career with a Lesson for Every Young Man and Woman in the Dominion. [Toronto?: np, 1907], 1 microfiche.

Mr. Timothy Eaton Died January 31st, 1907, Interred in Mount Pleasant Cemetery. [Toronto?: np, 1907?], 1 microfiche.

T. Eaton Co. Catalogue. Ottawa: Canadian Library Association, 19--, 45 microfilms.

T. Eaton Co. Souvenir. [Toronto?: np, ca 1900 and 1905], 1 microfiche.

Web Sites

Archives of Ontario. "The Toys of Our Childhood." www.archives.gov.on.ca/english/exhibits/toys/collections.htm

City of Toronto, Culture Division. www.city.toronto.on.ca/culture/museums.htm

Dictionary of Canadian Biography Online. "Timothy Eaton." www.biographi.ca/EN/ShowBio.asp?BioId=40819

Library and Archives Canada. Canadian Mail-order Catalogues.

www.collectionscanada.gc.ca/cmc/index-e.html

Saskatchewan Western Development Museum.

www.wdm.ca

Henry Morgan & Company

Secondary Sources

Publications

Filteau, Huguette. "Henry Morgan." In Dictionary of Canadian Biography, vol. 12 (1891-1900). Toronto: University of Toronto Press, 1990, pp. 828-829.

Henry Morgan & Co. 80 années de commerce, 1843-1923: À l'occasion de l'ouverture d'un nouveau bâtiment il est opportun de résumer les annales de nos 80 années d'affaires et de signaler les différents agrandissements qui en ont nécessairement résulté. Montréal: Henry Morgan & Company Limited, Federated Press Limited, 1923, 15 pp.

Knott, Leonard L. "Morgan's of Montreal." The Montrealer, May 1945,

pp. 22-25.

Morgan, David. The Morgans of Montreal. Toronto: D. Morgan, ca 1992, 209 pp.

Murray, Joan. "A Tradition of Change: Morgan's and the Bay on Phillips Square." / Une tradition en constante évolution: Les magasins Morgan et la Baie du carré Phillips. Toronto: Hudson's Bay Company Heritage Services, 2002.

Web Site

Dictionary of Canadian Biography Online. "Henry Morgan." www.biographi.ca/EN/ShowBio.asp?BioId=40435

Hudson's Bay Company

Primary Sources

There are few written sources on the history of the Hudson's Bay Company's retail and catalogue business.

Archives

Hudson's Bay Company Heritage Services, Toronto.

Hudson's Bay Company Archives, Provincial Archives of Manitoba, Winnipeg. Researchers can access annual reports, bulletins, catalogues, correspondence, and publications such as Bay News and The Beaver. A facsimile of the 1910-11 edition of the Hudson's Bay Company catalogue was published in 1977.

Web Sites

The HBC: Our History. http://www.hbc.com/hbcheritage/default.asp

Hudson's Bay Company Archives, Provincial Archives of Manitoba. http://www.gov.mb.ca/chc/archives/hbca/

Travelling Exhibition

"Mail, Rail, Retail: Connecting Canadians." This exhibition opened in November 2003 at the Canadian Museum of Civilization and will travel for five years.

Paquet

Primary Sources

Archives

Archives nationales du Québec, Quebec, Fonds Paquet, Le Syndicat, P 726. An excellent, recently established fonds.

Private Archives. Dictionary of Canadian Biography Project, Université Laval, Québec. "Zéphirin Paquet (1818-1905)."

Library and Archives Canada, Ottawa

Compagnie Paquet, Wholesale Division. Catalogue, 1907-1908: Skins and Furs, Gloves and Mitts, Hats and Caps, Moccasins and Snowshoes / Peaux vertes et fourrures, chapeaux et casquettes, gants et mitaines, souliers mous et raquettes. Québec: Compagnie Paquet Limitée, 1907, 53 pp.

Compagnie Paquet. Prospectus: Compagnie Paquet Limitée. [Québec: np, 1907], 8 pp.

Compagnie Paquet. Church Ornaments/Ornements d'église. Québec: Compagnie Paquet, 1930, 47 pp.

Compagnie Paquet. "Copie des dispositions de l'acte d'incorporation de la Compagnie Paquet, Limitée, de 1901(C. 73, 1 Ed. VII), sanctionnée le 26 mars 1901." [Québec: np, 1906?], 1 p.

Paquet, Joseph Octave. Compagnie Paquet. Quebec. Legislature. Legislative Assembly. "Pétition de Joseph Octave Paquet et autres contre le Bill B du Conseil législatif intitulé 'Loi amendant la loi constituant en corporation la Compagnie Paquet, Limitée, et accordant de nouveaux pouvoirs'." [Québec: np, 1906?], 4 pp.

Secondary Sources

Publications

Alcas-Marie, Brother, F.É.C., preface by Brother Marie-Victorin. Zéphirin Paquet: Sa famille, sa vie, son œuvre. Essai de monographie familiale. Québec: [np], 1927, 374 pp.

Lebel, Alyne. "Une vitrine populaire - Les grands magasins Paquet." Cap-aux-Diamants, 4, no. 2 (Summer 1988): 45-48.

Lessard, Michel. "La cie Paquet - Images de la Belle Époque." Cap-aux-Diamants, no. 40 (Winter 1995): 38-40.

Vallières, Marc. "Zéphirin Paquet." In Dictionary of Canadian Biography, vol. 13, (1901-1910). Toronto: University of Toronto Press, 1994, pp. 808-09.

"St-Joseph Street, Quebec City, P.Q." Canadian Variety Merchandising, May 1952, pp. 9-24.

Web Site

Dictionary of Canadian Biography Online. "Zéphirin Paquet" www.biographi.ca/EN/ShowBio.asp?BioId=41105

P. T. Legaré

Primary Sources

Archives

There is little documentation on P. T. Legaré.

Library and Archives Canada, Ottawa

RG-95, Corporations Branch, Series 1, vol. 1612. Various documents on P. T. Legaré.

P. T. Legaré Limitée. Catalogue no. 13, 1912. Québec: P. T. Legaré Limitée, 204 pp.

P. T. Legaré Limitée. Catalogue no. 44, 1920. Québec: P. T. Legaré Limitée, 422 pp.

Secondary Sources

Publications

Giroux, Jean-Luc. "Chronique du jeton: Jeton P. T. Legaré." Bulletin de liaison (Société numismatique de Québec), (May-June 1998): 69-70.

Lessard, Michel. "L'empire P. T. Legaré Limitée." Cap-aux-Diamants, no. 40 (Winter 1995): 34-37.

"Legaré Firm to Reorganize: Charges Laid." The Financial Post, July 25, 1936, p. 11.

Lechasseur, Antonio. "Pierre-Théophile Legaré." Forthcoming publication in Dictionary of Canadian Biography.

Simpson's and Simpsons-Sears

Primary Sources

Archives

The best collection of Simpson's catalogues can be found at the Sears head office in Toronto.

Hudson's Bay Company Heritage Services, Toronto, has a fair amount of material on Simpson's including catalogues, correspondence, and newspaper clippings.

Library and Archives Canada, Ottawa

MacLellan, Robert S. Pricing Practices of Miss Mary Maxim Ltd.: A Report in the Matter of an Inquiry Relating to the Distribution and Sale of Mary Maxim Knitting Wool, Patterns and Accessories Thereof in Canada. Restrictive Trade Practices Commission. Ottawa: [Queen's Printer]: 1966, 44 pp.

Simpsons-Sears Limited. Annual Report. Toronto: Simpsons-Sears Limited, [19--]-1983.

Simpsons Limited. Annual Report. Toronto: np, 1928/29?-1978/79.

Secondary Sources

Publications

Burton, Charles Luther. A Sense of Urgency: Memoirs of a Canadian Merchant. Toronto: Clarke, Irwin, 1952, 363 pp.

Burton, G. Allan. A Store of Memories. Toronto: McClelland and Stewart,

ca 1986, 330 pp.

Denison, Merrill. This Is Simpson's: A Story of Canadian Achievement Told in the Celebration of the 75th Anniversary of One of Her Great Institutions. Toronto: Simpson's Limited, 1947, 18 pp.

Ferry, John William. A History of the Department Store. New York: The MacMillan Company, 1960, 387 pp.

The Men Who Took Giant Steps: The Story of Simpsons Limited. Ont ?: np, nd, 59 pp.

"Robert Simpson." In Encyclopedia Canadiana, vol. 9. Toronto: Grolier, 1975, p. 317.

Santink, Joy L. "Robert Simpson." In Dictionary of Canadian Biography, vol. 12, pp. 1059-1061. Toronto: University of Toronto Press, 1994, pp.

Santink, Joy L. "Robert Simpson." In The Canadian Encyclopedia, 2nd edition, vol. 3. Edmonton: Hurtig Publishers, 1988, p. 2006.

"Simpsons Limited." In The Canadian Encyclopedia, 2nd edition, vol. 3. Edmonton: Hurtig Publishers, 1988, p. 2006.

Simpsons-Sears Limited. Simpsons-Sears: The First Twenty-Five years. Toronto: Simpsons-Sears Limited, 1979, 128 pp.

Toronto Star. The Simpsons Century. Toronto: The Toronto Star Limited, 1972.

Web Site

Dictionary of Canadian Biography Online. "Robert Simpson." www.biographi.ca/EN/ShowBio.asp?BioId=40554

Woodward's

Primary Sources

Archives

The City of Vancouver Archives and Hudson's Bay Company Heritage Services, Toronto, both have archival fonds concerning Woodward's.

Library and Archives Canada, Ottawa

Woodward's Limited. Annual Report. Vancouver: Woodward's Limited, 1984-1985.

Woodward's Limited. Annual Report. Vancouver: Woodward's Limited, 1991-.

Secondary Sources

Publications

Harker, Douglas E. The City and the Store. Vancouver: Woodward's, 1958.

Harker, Douglas E. The Woodwards: The Story of a Distinguished British Columbia Family, 1850-1975. Vancouver: Mitchell Press, ca 1976, 316 pp.

Woodward Stores Limited with Robert D. Watt, ed. The Shopping Guide to the West: Woodward's Catalogue, 1898-1953. Vancouver: Douglas and McIntyre, 1978, 174 pp.

Woodward Stores Limited. So Much to Celebrate: Woodward's 100th Anniversary. Vancouver: Woodward Stores Ltd., 1992, 71 pp.
